intro: Notopterygium weberbauerianum, commonly known as the Chinese angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and finely divided, feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are often used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported therapeutic properties. Notopterygium weberbauerianum thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes.
